1000  //============================================================================
1001  // Method Description:
1013  template<typename dtype>
1014  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
1015  {
1016  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
1017  {
1018  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
1019  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1020  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1021  }
1022 
1023  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
1024  {
1025  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
1026  {
1027  return false;
1028  }
1029  }
1030 
1031  return true;
1032  }

1085  //============================================================================
1086  // Method Description:
1099  template<typename dtype>
1100  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1101  {
1102  switch (inAxis)
1103  {
1104  case Axis::NONE:
1105  {
1106  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1107  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1108  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1109 
1110  return std::move(returnArray);
1111  }
1112  case Axis::ROW:
1113  {
1114  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1115  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1116  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1117  {
1118  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1119  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1120  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1121  }
1122 
1123  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1124  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1125  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1126 
1127  return std::move(returnArray);
1128  }
1129  case Axis::COL:
1130  {
1131  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1132  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1133  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1134  {
1135  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1136  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1137  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1138  }
1139 
1140  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1141  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1142  {
1143  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1144  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1145  }
1146 
1147  return std::move(returnArray);
1148  }
1149  default:
1150  {
1151  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1152  // of the compiler warning.
1153  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1154  }
1155  }
1156  }
1157 
1158  //============================================================================
1159  // Method Description:
1178  template<typename dtype>
1179  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1180  {
1181  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1182  {
1183  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1184  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1185  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1186  }
1187 
1188  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1189  {
1190  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1191  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1192  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1193  }
1194 
1195  std::vector<dtype> values;
1196 
1197  dtype theValue = inStart;
1198 
1199  if (inStep > 0)
1200  {
1201  while (theValue < inStop)
1202  {
1203  values.push_back(theValue);
1204  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1205  }
1206  }
1207  else
1208  {
1209  while (theValue > inStop)
1210  {
1211  values.push_back(theValue);
1212  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1213  }
1214  }
1215 
1216  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
1217  }
1218 
1219  //============================================================================
1220  // Method Description:
1238  template<typename dtype>
1239  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1240  {
1241  if (inStop <= 0)
1242  {
1243  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1244  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1245  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1246  }
1247 
1248  return std::move(arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1));
1249  }

1464  template<typename dtype>
1465  NdArray<double> arctan2(const NdArray<dtype>& inY, const NdArray<dtype>& inX)

1745  //============================================================================
1746  // Method Description:
1757  template<typename dtype>
1758  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1759  {
1760  switch (inAxis)
1761  {
1762  case Axis::NONE:
1763  {
1764  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1765  {
1766  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1767  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1768  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1769  }
1770 
1771  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1772  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1773 
1774  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1775  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1776 
1777  return std::move(returnArray);
1778  }
1779  case Axis::COL:
1780  {
1781  Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1782  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1783  {
1784  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1785  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1786  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1787  }
1788 
1789  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1790  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1791  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1792  {
1793  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1794  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1795 
1796  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1797  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1798  }
1799 
1800  return std::move(returnArray);
1801  }
1802  case Axis::ROW:
1803  {
1804  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1805  {
1806  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1807  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1808  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1809  }
1810 
1811  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1812 
1813  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1814  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1815  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1816  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1817  {
1818  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1819  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1820 
1821  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1822  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1823  }
1824 
1825  return std::move(returnArray);
1826  }
1827  default:
1828  {
1829  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1830  // of the compiler warning.
1831  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
1832  }
1833  }
1834  }

1852  //============================================================================
1853  // Method Description:
1870  template<typename dtype>
1871  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1872  {
1873  // only works with integer input types
1874  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1875 
1876  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1877  if (maxValue < 0)
1878  {
1879  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1880  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1881  }
1882 
1883  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1884  {
1885  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1886  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1887  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1888  }
1889 
1890  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1891  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1892 
1893  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1894  outArray.zeros();
1895  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1896  {
1897  ++outArray[clippedArray[i]];
1898  }
1899 
1900  return std::move(outArray);
1901  }

1903  //============================================================================
1904  // Method Description:
1924  template<typename dtype>
1925  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
1926  {
1927  // only works with integer input types
1928  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1929 
1930  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
1931  {
1932  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
1933  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1934  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1935  }
1936 
1937  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1938  if (maxValue < 0)
1939  {
1940  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1941  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1942  }
1943 
1944  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1945  {
1946  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1947  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1948  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1949  }
1950 
1951  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1952  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1953 
1954  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1955  outArray.zeros();
1956  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1957  {
1958  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
1959  }
1960 
1961  return std::move(outArray);
1962  }

2155  //============================================================================
2156  // Method Description:
2166  template<typename dtype>
2167  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2168  {
2169  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2170  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2171  Shape finalShape;
2172  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2173  {
2174  if (finalShape.isnull())
2175  {
2176  finalShape = iter->shape();
2177  }
2178  else if (iter->shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2179  {
2180  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2181  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2182  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2183  }
2184  else
2185  {
2186  finalShape.cols += iter->shape().cols;
2187  }
2188  }
2189 
2190  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2191  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2192  uint32 colStart = 0;
2193  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2194  {
2195  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
2196  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2197  {
2198  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2199  {
2200  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
2201  }
2202  }
2203  colStart += theShape.cols;
2204  }
2205 
2206  return std::move(returnArray);
2207  }
2208 
2209  //============================================================================
2210  // Method Description:
2220  template<typename dtype>
2221  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2222  {
2223  switch (inAxis)
2224  {
2225  case Axis::NONE:
2226  {
2227  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2228  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2229  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2230  {
2231  finalSize += iter->size();
2232  }
2233 
2234  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2235  uint32 offset = 0;
2236  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2237  {
2238  std::copy(iter->cbegin(), iter->cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2239  offset += iter->size();
2240  }
2241 
2242  return std::move(returnArray);
2243  }
2244  case Axis::ROW:
2245  {
2246  return std::move(row_stack(inArrayList));
2247  }
2248  case Axis::COL:
2249  {
2250  return std::move(column_stack(inArrayList));
2251  }
2252  default:
2253  {
2254  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2255  // of the compiler warning.
2256  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2257  }
2258  }
2259  }

2425  template<typename dtype>
2426  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2427  {
2428  switch (inAxis)
2429  {
2430  case Axis::NONE:
2431  {
2432  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.nonzero().size() };
2433  return count;
2434  }
2435  case Axis::COL:
2436  {
2437  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();

2444  {
2445  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2446  {
2447  ++returnArray(0, row);
2448  }
2449  }
2450  }
2451 
2452  return std::move(returnArray);
2453  }
2454  case Axis::ROW:
2455  {
2456  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2457 
2458  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.cols);
2459  returnArray.zeros();
2460  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2461  {
2462  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2463  {
2464  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2465  {
2466  ++returnArray(0, col);
2467  }
2468  }
2469  }
2470 
2471  return std::move(returnArray);
2472  }
2473  default:
2474  {
2475  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2476  // of the compiler warning.
2477  return std::move(NdArray<uint32>(0));

2479  }
2480  }

2482  //============================================================================
2483  // Method Description:
2494  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2495  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2496  {
2497  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2498  {
2499  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2500  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2501  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2502  }
2503 
2504  switch (inAxis)
2505  {
2506  case Axis::NONE:
2507  {
2508  uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2509  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2510  {
2511  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2512  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2513  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2514  }
2515 
2516  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2517  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2518 
2519  switch (arraySize)
2520  {
2521  case 2:
2522  {
2523  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2524  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2525  return std::move(returnArray);
2526  }
2527  case 3:
2528  {
2529  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2530  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2531  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2532  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2533  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2534  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2535 
2536  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2537  return std::move(returnArray);
2538  }
2539  default:
2540  {
2541  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2542  // of the compiler warning.
2543  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2544  }
2545  }
2546  }
2547  case Axis::ROW:
2548  {
2549  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2550  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2551  {
2552  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2553  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2554  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2555  }
2556 
2557  Shape returnArrayShape;
2558  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2559  {
2560  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2561  }
2562  else
2563  {
2564  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2565  }
2566 
2567  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2568  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2569  {
2570  int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2571  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2572  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2573  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2574 
2575  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2576  }
2577 
2578  return std::move(returnArray);
2579  }
2580  case Axis::COL:
2581  {
2582  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2583  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2584  {
2585  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2586  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2587  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2588  }
2589 
2590  Shape returnArrayShape;
2591  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2592  {
2593  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2594  }
2595  else
2596  {
2597  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2598  }
2599 
2600  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2601  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2602  {
2603  int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2604  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2605  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2606  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2607 
2608  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2609  }
2610 
2611  return std::move(returnArray);
2612  }
2613  default:
2614  {
2615  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2616  // of the compiler warning.
2617  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2618  }
2619  }
2620  }

2760  //============================================================================
2761  // Method Description:
2770  template<typename dtype>
2771  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2772  {
2773  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2774  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2775 
2776  switch (inAxis)
2777  {
2778  case Axis::NONE:
2779  {
2780  std::vector<dtype> values;
2781  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2782  {
2783  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2784  {
2785  continue;
2786  }
2787 
2788  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2789  }
2790 
2791  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
2792  }
2793  case Axis::ROW:
2794  {
2795  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2796  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2797  {
2798  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2799  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2800  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2801  }
2802 
2803  uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2804  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2805 
2806  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2807  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2808  {
2809  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2810  {
2811  continue;
2812  }
2813 
2814  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2815  {
2816  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2817  }
2818  ++rowCounter;
2819  }
2820 
2821  return std::move(returnArray);
2822  }
2823  case Axis::COL:
2824  {
2825  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2826  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2827  {
2828  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2829  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2830  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2831  }
2832 
2833  uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2834  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2835 
2836  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2837  {
2838  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2839  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2840  {
2841  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2842  {
2843  continue;
2844  }
2845 
2846  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2847  }
2848  }
2849 
2850  return std::move(returnArray);
2851 
2852 
2853  }
2854  default:
2855  {
2856  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2857  // of the compiler warning.
2858  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2859  }
2860  }
2861  }
2862 
2863  //============================================================================
2864  // Method Description:
2873  template<typename dtype>
2874  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2875  {
2876  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2877 
2878  switch (inAxis)
2879  {
2880  case Axis::NONE:
2881  {
2882  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2883  break;
2884  }
2885  case Axis::ROW:
2886  {
2887  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2888  break;
2889  }
2890  case Axis::COL:
2891  {
2892  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2893  break;
2894  }
2895  }
2896 
2897  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2898  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2899  {
2900  indices.push_back(i);
2901  }
2902 
2903  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis));
2904  }

2918  {
2919  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
2920  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis));

2977  template<typename dtype>
2978  NdArray<dtype> diff(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2979  {
2980  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2981 
2982  switch (inAxis)
2983  {
2984  case Axis::NONE:
2985  {
2986  if (inArray.size() < 2)
2987  {
2988  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2989  }
2990 
2991  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - 1);
2992  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
2993  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
2994 
2995  return std::move(returnArray);
2996  }
2997  case Axis::COL:
2998  {
2999  if (inShape.cols < 2)
3000  {
3001  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3002  }
3003 
3004  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols - 1);
3005  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
3006  {
3007  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row) - 1, inArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3008  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3009  }
3010 
3011  return std::move(returnArray);
3012  }
3013  case Axis::ROW:
3014  {
3015  if (inShape.rows < 2)
3016  {
3017  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3018  }
3019 
3020  NdArray<dtype> transArray = inArray.transpose();
3021  Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
3022  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
3023  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
3024  {
3025  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3026  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3027  }
3028 
3029  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3030  }
3031  default:
3032  {
3033  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
3034  // of the compiler warning.
3035  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3036  }
3037  }
3038  }

3546  // Method Description:
3556  template<typename dtype>
3557  NdArray<dtype> flip(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3558  {
3559  switch (inAxis)
3560  {
3561  case Axis::NONE:
3562  {
3563  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3564  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.end());
3565  return std::move(returnArray);
3566  }
3567  case Axis::COL:
3568  {
3569  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3570  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3571  {
3572  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3573  }
3574  return std::move(returnArray);
3575  }
3576  case Axis::ROW:
3577  {
3578  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
3579  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3580  {
3581  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3582  }
3583  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3584  }
3585  default:
3586  {
3587  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3588  }
3589  }
3590  }

3857  //============================================================================
3858  // Method Description:
3870  template<typename dtype>
3871  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
3872  {
3873  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
3874  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
3875  {
3876  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
3877  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3878  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3879  }
3880 
3881  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
3882  {
3883  // read in as binary file
3884  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
3885  in.seekg(0, in.end);
3886  uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
3887 
3888  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
3889  if (filePtr == NULL)
3890  {
3891  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
3892  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3893  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3894  }
3895 
3896  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
3897  size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
3898  fclose(filePtr);
3899 
3900  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), static_cast<uint32>(bytesRead));
3901  delete[] fileBuffer;
3902 
3903  return std::move(returnArray);
3904  }
3905  else
3906  {
3907  // read in as txt file
3908  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
3909  {
3910  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
3911  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3912  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3913  }
3914 
3915  std::vector<dtype> values;
3916 
3917  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
3918  if (file.is_open())
3919  {
3920  while (!file.eof())
3921  {
3922  std::string line;
3923  std::getline(file, line);
3924 
3925  std::istringstream iss(line);
3926  try
3927  {
3928  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
3929  }
3930  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
3931  {
3932  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
3934  }
3935  }
3936  file.close();
3937  }
3938  else
3939  {
3940  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
3941  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3942  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3943  }
3944 
3945  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
3946  }
3947  }

4105  //============================================================================
4106  // Method Description:
4118  template<typename dtype>
4119  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
4120  {
4121  if (inNumBins == 0)
4122  {
4123  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
4124  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4125  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4126  }
4127 
4128  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
4129 
4130  bool useEndPoint = true;
4131  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
4132  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
4133 
4134  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
4135  {
4136  // binary search to find the bin idx
4137  bool keepSearching = true;
4138  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
4139  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
4140  while (keepSearching)
4141  {
4142  uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
4143  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
4144  {
4145  // we found the bin
4146  ++histo[lowIdx];
4147  break;
4148  }
4149 
4150  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
4151  {
4152  lowIdx = idx;
4153  }
4154  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
4155  {
4156  highIdx = idx;
4157  }
4158  else
4159  {
4160  // we found the bin
4161  ++histo[idx];
4162  break;
4163  }
4164  }
4165  }
4166 
4167  return std::move(std::make_pair(histo, binEdges));
4168  }

4285  //============================================================================
4286  // Method Description:
4303  template<typename dtype>
4304  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4305  {
4306  // do some error checking first
4307  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4308  {
4309  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4310  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4311  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4312  }
4313 
4314  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4315  {
4316  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4317  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4318  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4319  }
4320 
4321  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4322  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4323  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4324  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4325  for (uint32 i = 0; i < sortedXpIdxs.size(); ++i)
4326  {
4327  sortedXp[i] = inXp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4328  sortedFp[i] = inFp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4329  }
4330 
4331  // sort the input inX array
4332  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4333 
4334  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4335 
4336  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4337  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4338  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4339  {
4340  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4341  {
4342  double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4343  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4344  returnArray[currXidx++] = Utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4345  }
4346  else
4347  {
4348  ++currXpIdx;
4349  }
4350  }
4351 
4352  return std::move(returnArray);
4353  }
4354 
4355  //============================================================================
4356  // Method Description:
4369  template<typename dtype>
4370  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4371  {
4372  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4373  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4374  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4375 
4376  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4377  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4378  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4379  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
4380  }

4666  //============================================================================
4667  // Method Description:
4688  template<typename dtype>
4689  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4690  {
4691  if (inNum == 0)
4692  {
4693  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
4694  }
4695  else if (inNum == 1)
4696  {
4697  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4698  return std::move(returnArray);
4699  }
4700 
4701  if (inStop <= inStart)
4702  {
4703  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4704  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4705  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4706  }
4707 
4708  if (endPoint)
4709  {
4710  if (inNum == 2)
4711  {
4712  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4713  return std::move(returnArray);
4714  }
4715  else
4716  {
4717  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4718  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4719  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4720 
4721  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4722  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4723  {
4724  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4725  }
4726 
4727  return std::move(returnArray);
4728  }
4729  }
4730  else
4731  {
4732  if (inNum == 2)
4733  {
4734  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4735  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4736  return std::move(returnArray);
4737  }
4738  else
4739  {
4740  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4741  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4742 
4743  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4744  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4745  {
4746  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4747  }
4748 
4749  return std::move(returnArray);
4750  }
4751  }
4752  }
4753

5357  //============================================================================
5358  // Method Description:
5369  template<typename dtype>
5370  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5371  {
5372  switch (inAxis)
5373  {
5374  case Axis::NONE:
5375  {
5376  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5377  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5378 
5379  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5380  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5381 
5382  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5383 
5384  return std::move(returnArray);
5385  }
5386  case Axis::COL:
5387  {
5388  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5389  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5390  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5391  {
5392  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5393  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5394 
5395  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5396  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5397 
5398  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5399  }
5400 
5401  return std::move(returnArray);
5402  }
5403  case Axis::ROW:
5404  {
5405  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5406  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5407  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5408  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5409  {
5410  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5411  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5412 
5413  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5414  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5415 
5416  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5417  }
5418 
5419  return std::move(returnArray);
5420  }
5421  default:
5422  {
5423  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5424  // of the compiler warning.
5425  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5426  }
5427  }
5428  }

5430  //============================================================================
5431  // Method Description:
5442  template<typename dtype>
5443  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5444  {
5445  switch (inAxis)

5448  {
5449  std::vector<dtype> values;
5450  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5451  {
5452  if (!std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5453  {
5454  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
5455  }
5456  }
5457 
5458  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5459  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5460  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5461 
5462  return std::move(returnArray);
5463  }
5464  case Axis::COL:
5465  {
5466  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5467  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5468  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5469  {
5470  std::vector<dtype> values;
5471  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5472  {
5473  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5474  {
5475  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5476  }
5477  }
5478 
5479  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5480  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5481  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5482  }
5483 
5484  return std::move(returnArray);
5485  }
5486  case Axis::ROW:
5487  {
5488  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5489  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5490  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5491  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5492  {
5493  std::vector<dtype> values;
5494  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5495  {
5496  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5497  {
5498  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5499  }
5500  }
5501 
5502  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5503  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5504  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5505  }
5506 
5507  return std::move(returnArray);
5508  }
5509  default:
5510  {
5511  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5512  // of the compiler warning.

5515  }

5545  //============================================================================
5546  // Method Description:
5558  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5559  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5560  {
5561  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
5562  {
5563  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5564  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5565  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5566  }
5567 
5568  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5569  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5570  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5571  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5572  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5573  {
5574  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5575  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5576  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5577  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5578  }
5579 
5580  switch (inAxis)
5581  {
5582  case Axis::NONE:
5583  {
5584  if (inPercentile == 0)
5585  {
5586  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5587  {
5588  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5589  {
5590  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5591  return std::move(returnArray);
5592  }
5593  }
5594  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5595  }
5596  else if (inPercentile == 1)
5597  {
5598  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5599  {
5600  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5601  {
5602  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5603  return std::move(returnArray);
5604  }
5605  }
5606  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5607  }
5608 
5609  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5610  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5611  for (uint32 j = 0; j < inArray.size(); ++j)
5612  {
5613  if (!isnan(inArray[j]))
5614  {
5615  arrayCopy.push_back(inArray[j]);
5616  ++numNonNan;
5617  }
5618  }
5619 
5620  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5621  {
5622  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5623  }
5624 
5625  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5626  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5627 
5628  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5629 
5630  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5631  {
5632  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5633  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5634  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5635 
5636  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5637  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5638  return std::move(returnArray);
5639  }
5640  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5641  {
5642  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5643  return std::move(returnArray);
5644  }
5645  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5646  {
5647  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5648  return std::move(returnArray);
5649  }
5650  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5651  {
5652  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5653  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5654  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5655  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5656  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5657 
5658  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5659  {
5660  case 0:
5661  {
5662  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5663  return std::move(returnArray);
5664  }
5665  case 1:
5666  {
5667  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5668  return std::move(returnArray);
5669  }
5670  }
5671  }
5672  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5673  {
5674  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5675  return std::move(returnArray);
5676  }
5677  }
5678  case Axis::COL:
5679  {
5680  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5681 
5682  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5683  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5684  {
5685  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5686  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5687 
5688  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5689  {
5690  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5691  }
5692  else
5693  {
5694  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5695  }
5696  }
5697 
5698  return std::move(returnArray);
5699  }
5700  case Axis::ROW:
5701  {
5702  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
5703  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
5704 
5705  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5706  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5707  {
5708  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
5709  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5710 
5711  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5712  {
5713  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5714  }
5715  else
5716  {
5717  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5718  }
5719  }
5720 
5721  return std::move(returnArray);
5722  }
5723  default:
5724  {
5725  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5726  // of the compiler warning.
5727  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5728  }
5729  }
5730  }
5731

5733  // Method Description:
5744  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5745  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5746  {
5747  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5748  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5749  {
5750  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5751  {
5752  arrayCopy[i] = 1;
5753  }
5754  }
5755 
5756  return std::move(prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5757  }

5824  //============================================================================
5825  // Method Description:
5836  template<typename dtype>
5837  NdArray<double> nanstd(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5838  {
5839  switch (inAxis)
5840  {
5841  case Axis::NONE:
5842  {
5843  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
5844  double sum = 0;
5845  double counter = 0;
5846  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5847  {
5848  if (std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5849  {
5850  continue;
5851  }
5852 
5853  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray[i]) - meanValue);
5854  ++counter;
5855  }
5856  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
5857  return std::move(returnArray);
5858  }
5859  case Axis::COL:
5860  {
5861  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5862  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5863  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5864  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5865  {
5866  double sum = 0;
5867  double counter = 0;
5868  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5869  {
5870  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5871  {
5872  continue;
5873  }
5874 
5875  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5876  ++counter;
5877  }
5878  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5879  }
5880 
5881  return std::move(returnArray);
5882  }
5883  case Axis::ROW:
5884  {
5885  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
5886  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5887  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5888  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5889  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5890  {
5891  double sum = 0;
5892  double counter = 0;
5893  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5894  {
5895  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5896  {
5897  continue;
5898  }
5899 
5900  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
5901  ++counter;
5902  }
5903  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
5904  }
5905 
5906  return std::move(returnArray);
5907  }
5908  default:
5909  {
5910  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5911  // of the compiler warning.
5912  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5913  }
5914  }
5915  }
5916

5930  NdArray<dtypeOut> nansum(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)

5932  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5933  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5934  {
5935  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5936  {
5937  arrayCopy[i] = 0;
5938  }
5939  }
5940 
5941  return std::move(sum<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5942  }

6217  //============================================================================
6218  // Method Description:
6235  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6236  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
6237  {
6238  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
6239  {
6240  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
6241  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6242  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6243  }
6244 
6245  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
6246  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
6247  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
6248  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
6249  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
6250  {
6251  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
6252  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
6253  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6254  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6255  }
6256 
6257  switch (inAxis)
6258  {
6259  case Axis::NONE:
6260  {
6261  if (inPercentile == 0)
6262  {
6263  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cbegin()) };
6264  return std::move(returnArray);
6265  }
6266  else if (inPercentile == 1)
6267  {
6268  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cend()) };
6269  return std::move(returnArray);
6270  }
6271 
6272  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
6273  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
6274 
6275  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
6276  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
6277 
6278  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6279  {
6280  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6281  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6282  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6283 
6284  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6285  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6286  return std::move(returnArray);
6287  }
6288  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6289  {
6290  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6291  return std::move(returnArray);
6292  }
6293  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6294  {
6295  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6296  return std::move(returnArray);
6297  }
6298  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6299  {
6300  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6301  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6302  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6303  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6304  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6305 
6306  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6307  {
6308  case 0:
6309  {
6310  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6311  return std::move(returnArray);
6312  }
6313  case 1:
6314  {
6315  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6316  return std::move(returnArray);
6317  }
6318  }
6319  }
6320  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6321  {
6322  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6323  return std::move(returnArray);
6324  }
6325  }
6326  case Axis::COL:
6327  {
6328  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6329 
6330  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6331  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6332  {
6333  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6334  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6335  }
6336 
6337  return std::move(returnArray);
6338  }
6339  case Axis::ROW:
6340  {
6341  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6342  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6343 
6344  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6345  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6346  {
6347  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6348  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6349  }
6350 
6351  return std::move(returnArray);
6352  }
6353  default:
6354  {
6355  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6356  // of the compiler warning.
6357  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
6358  }
6359  }
6360  }

6908  //============================================================================
6909  // Method Description:
6921  template<typename dtype>
6922  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis)
6923  {
6924  switch (inAxis)
6925  {
6926  case Axis::NONE:
6927  {
6928  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
6929  if (inShift > 0)
6930  {
6931  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
6932  }
6933 
6934  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6935  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
6936 
6937  return std::move(returnArray);
6938  }
6939  case Axis::COL:
6940  {
6941  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6942 
6943  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
6944  if (inShift > 0)
6945  {
6946  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
6947  }
6948 
6949  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
6950  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6951  {
6952  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6953  }
6954 
6955  return std::move(returnArray);
6956  }
6957  case Axis::ROW:
6958  {
6959  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6960 
6961  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
6962  if (inShift > 0)
6963  {
6964  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
6965  }
6966 
6967  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
6968  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
6969  {
6970  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
6971  }
6972 
6973  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
6974  }
6975  default:
6976  {
6977  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6978  // of the compiler warning.
6979  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
6980  }
6981  }
6982  }
6983 
6984  //============================================================================
6985  // Method Description:
6996  template<typename dtype>
6997  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK)
6998  {
6999  inK %= 4;
7000  switch (inK)
7001  {
7002  case 1:
7003  {
7004  return std::move(flipud(inArray.transpose()));
7005  }
7006  case 2:
7007  {
7008  return std::move(flip(inArray, Axis::NONE));
7009  }
7010  case 3:
7011  {
7012  return std::move(fliplr(inArray.transpose()));
7013  }
7014  default:
7015  {
7016  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7017  // of the compiler warning.
7018  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7019  }
7020  }
7021  }

7056  //============================================================================
7057  // Method Description:
7066  template<typename dtype>
7067  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
7068  {
7069  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
7070  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
7071  Shape finalShape;
7072  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7073  {
7074  if (finalShape.isnull())
7075  {
7076  finalShape = iter->shape();
7077  }
7078  else if (iter->shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
7079  {
7080  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
7081  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7082  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7083  }
7084  else
7085  {
7086  finalShape.rows += iter->shape().rows;
7087  }
7088  }
7089 
7090  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
7091  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
7092  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7093  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7094  {
7095  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
7096  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
7097  {
7098  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
7099  {
7100  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
7101  }
7102  }
7103  rowStart += theShape.rows;
7104  }
7105 
7106  return std::move(returnArray);
7107  }
7108 
7109  //============================================================================
7110  // Method Description:
7122  template<typename dtype>
7123  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
7124  {
7125  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
7126  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
7127  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
7128 
7129  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
7130  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
7131  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
7132  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
7133  }

7727  //============================================================================
7728  // Method Description:
7740  template<typename dtype>
7741  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis)
7742  {
7743  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7744  switch (inAxis)
7745  {
7746  case Axis::COL:
7747  {
7748  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
7749  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7750  {
7751  double sum = 0;
7752  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7753  {
7754  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
7755  }
7756 
7757  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7758  }
7759 
7760  return std::move(returnArray);
7761  }
7762  case Axis::ROW:
7763  {
7764  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
7765  Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
7766  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7767  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7768  {
7769  double sum = 0;
7770  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7771  {
7772  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
7773  }
7774 
7775  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7776  }
7777 
7778  return std::move(returnArray);
7779  }
7780  case Axis::NONE:
7781  {
7782  double sum = 0.0;
7783  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
7784  {
7785  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
7786  }
7787 
7788  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
7789  return std::move(returnArray);
7790  }
7791  default:
7792  {
7793  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7794  // of the compiler warning.
7795  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7796  }
7797  }
7798  }

7800  //============================================================================
7801  // Method Description:
7813  template<typename dtype>
7814  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
7815  {
7816  Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
7817  Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
7818 
7819  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
7820  {
7821  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
7822  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7823  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7824  }
7825 
7826  switch (inAxis)
7827  {
7828  case Axis::COL:
7829  {
7830  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
7831  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
7832  {
7833  double sum = 0;
7834  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
7835  {
7836  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
7837  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
7838  }
7839 
7840  returnArray[row] = sum;
7841  }
7842 
7843  return std::move(returnArray);
7844  }
7845  case Axis::ROW:
7846  {
7847  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
7848  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
7849  Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
7850  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7851  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7852  {
7853  double sum = 0;
7854  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7855  {
7856  double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
7857  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
7858  }
7859 
7860  returnArray[row] = sum;
7861  }
7862 
7863  return std::move(returnArray);
7864  }
7865  case Axis::NONE:
7866  {
7867  double sum = 0.0;
7868  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
7869  {
7870  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
7871  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
7872  }
7873 
7874  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
7875  return std::move(returnArray);
7876  }
7877  default:
7878  {
7879  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7880  // of the compiler warning.
7881  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7882  }
7883  }
7884  }

7899  template<typename dtype>
7900  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset)
7901  {
7902  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7903  uint32 colStart = 0;
7904  if (inOffset > 0)
7905  {
7906  colStart = inOffset;
7907  }
7908  else
7909  {
7910  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
7911  }
7912 
7913  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
7914  returnArray.zeros();
7915  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
7916  {
7917  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
7918  {
7919  if (col == inN)
7920  {
7921  break;
7922  }
7923 
7924  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
7925  }
7926  }
7927 
7928  return std::move(returnArray);
7929  }

8097  //============================================================================
8098  // Method Description:
8109  template<typename dtype>
8110  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
8111  {
8112  if (inTrim == "f")
8113  {
8114  uint32 place = 0;
8115  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8116  {
8117  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8118  {
8119  break;
8120  }
8121  else
8122  {
8123  ++place;
8124  }
8125  }
8126 
8127  if (place == inArray.size())
8128  {
8129  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8130  }
8131 
8132  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
8133  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
8134 
8135  return std::move(returnArray);
8136  }
8137  else if (inTrim == "b")
8138  {
8139  uint32 place = inArray.size();
8140  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8141  {
8142  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8143  {
8144  break;
8145  }
8146  else
8147  {
8148  --place;
8149  }
8150  }
8151 
8152  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8153  {
8154  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8155  }
8156 
8157  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
8158  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
8159 
8160  return std::move(returnArray);
8161  }
8162  else if (inTrim == "fb")
8163  {
8164  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
8165  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8166  {
8167  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8168  {
8169  break;
8170  }
8171  else
8172  {
8173  ++placeBegin;
8174  }
8175  }
8176 
8177  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
8178  {
8179  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8180  }
8181 
8182  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
8183  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8184  {
8185  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8186  {
8187  break;
8188  }
8189  else
8190  {
8191  --placeEnd;
8192  }
8193  }
8194 
8195  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8196  {
8197  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8198  }
8199 
8200  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
8201  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
8202 
8203  return std::move(returnArray);
8204  }
8205  else
8206  {
8207  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
8208  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8209  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8210  }
8211  }

8316  dtype unwrap(dtype inValue)
8317  {
8318  if (inValue < 0)
8319  {
8320  return inValue + 2 * Constants::pi;
8321  }
8322  else if (inValue >= 2 * Constants::pi)
8323  {
8324  return inValue - 2 * Constants::pi;
8325  }
8326  else
8327  {
8328  return inValue;
8329  }
8330  }

8403  template<typename dtype>
8404  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8405  {

8407  auto shapeA = inA.shape();

8409  {
8410  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";

8412  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8413  }
8414

8416  {
8417  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8418  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8419  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8420  }
8421 
8422  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8423 
8424  for (uint32 i = 0; i < shapeMask.size(); ++i)
8425  {
8426  if (inMask[i])
8427  {
8428  outArray[i] = inA[i];
8429  }
8430  else
8431  {
8432  outArray[i] = inB[i];
8433  }
8434  }
8435 
8436  return std::move(outArray);
8437  }
